From my research, I found that in modern African Civil wars, around 80% of them have documented groups murdering over 1,000 civilians at a time, systematically. Therefore, I start at a base of 80%. On the wikipedia page, it states in 2013, there already was a civilian massacre of thousands of men and women, and there are many documented cases of civilians being murdered for no reason. This Civil war is based much on religion, which causes me to believe there is a higher chance that some sort of ethnic/religious cleansing will occur in the future.

Central African Republic probably has a current situation where civilians are being systematically killed.  According to Human Rights Watch, civilians are being actively targeted in a war taking place now.  The United Nations is reporting violence targeting their workers.  The end of June of 2018 is a long time from now and genocidal type killings are already happening.  In my mind, the matter at hand is when the threshold of 1,000 is met, opposed to if a genocide will take place.
The trend is in the other direction, thank God
